item.title: The GOP’s 2026 outlook improves from worse to bad
item.description: A comfortable Tennessee special election win points to gloomy midterms, probably not a historic rout.

item.title: Gene Simmons: Congress, I have a plea for you
item.description: Long ago, broadcast radio helped bands like Kiss break through. Today, that business model is broken.

item.title: Trump’s boat strike playbook was written by Obama
item.description: The former president’s “double tap” attacks were not unlawful. Neither are the current one’s.

item.description: A federal court exceeds its role by second-guessing Congress on funding Planned Parenthood.

item.title: Making sense of the Henry Cuellar pardon
item.description: The president views clemency in the monarchical tradition. This undermines the rule of law.

item.title: It’s a strange ‘charity’ that pays fired football coaches $228M
item.description: The government should not treat university athletic departments like food banks.

item.title: What college students clearly haven’t learned about free speech
item.description: New campus survey shows nearly half of undergraduates “mostly” or “completely” conflate words and violence.

item.title: The CDC’s next anti-vaccine clown show is coming. Take your seats.
item.description: Delaying hepatitis B shots would be RFK Jr.’s most disruptive change yet to immunization policy.

item.title: Tim Walz can’t admit the downsides of too much welfare
item.description: Minnesota’s governor says fraud is a consequence of the state being too well-governed.

item.description: Leading in war is the hallmark of great American presidents.

item.title: How the bar exam failed Kim Kardashian
item.description: The test is not about quality control for lawyers, it’s about quantity control.

item.title: Americans shouldn’t need government permission slips to work
item.description: Firefighters show the case against “good character” provisions.

item.title: Introducing 'Reasonably Optimistic'
item.description: Enough with the doom and gloom — we’re ready to talk about how America can thrive. Hosted by Washington Post Opinion columnist Megan McArdle, “Reasonably Optimistic” is your weekly conversation about how America can get unstuck and build a better future. Stop feeding your rage and start embracing our possibilities. Episodes drop Wednesdays.
